thread.title: News you can use for Tuesday, Oct. 13, 2015
thread.title_full: News you can use for Tuesday, Oct. 13, 2015 | CP24.com

author: Web Staff, CP24.com
title: News you can use for Tuesday, Oct. 13, 2015
text:
Clouds and rain, truck rollovers and a pair of new baby pandas, here’s all the news you can use for Tuesday, Oct. 13, 2015.
Weather:
It’s 14 C this morning, rising to 17 C this afternoon, with partly cloudy skies. Sporadic rain may return this evening, with an overnight low expected of 9 C.
Traffic:
A rolled tractor-trailer has closed the southbound ramp from Brant Street to the QEW in Burlington. A motorcycle and car collision has closed the intersection of Major Mackenzie Drive and Weston Road in Vaughan. The TTC is running normally, while there are delays of between 5 and 10 minutes on GO Transit’s Lakeshore West and Richmond Hill lines.
News Headlines:
Toronto Zoo panda Er Shun gives birth to two twin cubs
Opening statements expected at Sammy Yatim murder trial
Toronto leads Canadian cities in child poverty
Playboy magazine to stop publishing nude photos in magazine
Sports:
None of Toronto’s professional sports teams are playing today, but the Toronto Blue Jays will look to win their American League Division Series when they play the Texas Rangers at the Rogers Centre tomorrow.
Events:
Indie Week Launch
Watch Paddington at Brentwood Library
TSO plays Sinatra Hits
Birds of America
